channel.title: Transparent Login Box?
channel.description:
is there any way i can have a transparent login box ?
If So How?

item.title: Transparent Login Box?
item.dc:creator: @Mighty_Penguin Mighty Penguin
item.description:
@Mighty_Penguin wrote:

If you download the KevenScape Client and make the login box white and compile your login will become transparent.

Read full topic

item.title: Transparent Login Box?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Take a look at http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/2d/images/drawimage.html. It teaches you how to in the end, add an alpha channel, which controls how much you can see through an image. I’m not sure how the client draws the login images, but I’d guess it uses methods similar to those found on that web page.

Read full topic

item.title: Transparent Login Box?
item.dc:creator: @Destruction Destruction
item.description:
@Destruction wrote:

[quote=“stscarface, post:10, topic:314530”][quote author=Destruction link=topic=411007.msg3031828#msg3031828 date=1258430980]

Transparent as in parts that get cut off and have the back showing (Like a circle), or something that you partially see through like looking through a piece of blue plastic?

Yeah what stscarface said. Transparent as you can see through it.
[/quote]

hey i used toms cache suit editor and when i removed the logo.dat and compiled the client did not work any suggestions?[/quote]

No don’t remove the logo.dat. Go into “Edit Image Archives” and click title.jag. You will see a loginbox and then click it, click dump file, put it wherever you want, and use photoshop to edit it and save it.

Read full topic

item.title: Transparent Login Box?
item.dc:creator: @Destruction Destruction
item.description:
@Destruction wrote:

Javafire:

I didn’t even know tht nice 1 destruction rep ++!

Thanks lol. And that will only work if you do not already have a custom log in box. But to remove it from being a custom sprite, just search the name of the sprite of the log in box, and use a Java filesearcher and search for the name of it and delete it from all the files it’s in so it is not drawn to your client.

Read full topic

item.title: Transparent Login Box?
item.dc:creator: @Destruction Destruction
item.description:
@Destruction wrote:

No don’t do that, that is the most difficult possible way. They way you do it is to use Tom’s Cache Suite, dump the login box, and replace the whole image with the purple/pinkish color that is in the corner, and import it back into your cache.

Read full topic
